data.title: Rasheed Wallace Net Worth
data.meta_description: Rasheed Wallace is an American former basketball player and coach. As of 2024, Rasheed Wallace's net worth is estimated to be $75 million.
data.text:
What is Rasheed Wallace’s net worth?

Net Worth:$75 Million Age:49 Born:September 17, 1974 Gender:Male Height:2.13 m (7 ft 0 in) Country of Origin:United States of America Source of Wealth:Professional NBA Player Last Updated:Jul 25, 2024

Table of Contents

Toggle

Introduction

Rasheed Abdul Wallace is a former professional basketball player and current coach who started his NBA career in 1995.

While he was originally drafted by the Washington Bullets, Wallace played for six different teams before retiring.

Despite leaving the court in 2013, he started his coaching career the same year and now works with the Memphis Tigers men’s basketball team.

As of July 2024, Rasheed Wallace’s net worth is estimated to be $75 Million.

Rasheed Wallace Facts

Rasheed Wallace declared himself for the 1995 NBA draft and joined the Washington Bullets.

Wallace won the NBA Championship in 2004 with the Detroit Pistons.

During the 2000-01 season, Wallace set the record for the most technical fouls in a single season.

In 2013, Wallace joined the Detroit Pistons as an assistant coach, later coaching at Jordan High School in 2019.

Rasheed Wallace has been extremely vocal about the Flint water crisis and, in 2016, personally delivered water door-to-door to those who needed it.

Early Life

Rasheed Abdul Wallace was born September 17, 1974, in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.

At Simon Gratz High School, Rasheed was named USA Today’s High School Player of the Year, and after his senior season, he was named First-Team All-American by the Basketball Times.

He started his college career at the University of North Carolina, where he continued to make a name for himself on the court.

During his second season with North Carolina, he was named a second-team All-American, and he helped lead his team to the NCAA Final Four in 1995.

However, the same year, he left North Carolina to enter the NBA draft, where he was selected by the Washington Bullets.

Career

Rasheed Wallace started his professional basketball playing career in 1995 with the Washington Bullets, who he played one season with.

In 1996, he was traded to the Portland Trail Blazers, who he would play with until 2004, and during his time with Portland, Wallance was named an NBA All-Star twice.

Wallace was traded to the Detroit Pistons in 2004, and he recorded 26 points, 13 rebounds, and two assists during the NBA Finals in his first season with them.

He continued to exceed expectations on the court, earning another NBA All-Star appearance.

However, in 2009 he was traded again, this time to the Boston Celtics, where he would stay for only a single season before retiring.

Rasheed came out of retirement to play for the New York Knicks in 2012, though he ended up injuring his foot early in the season.

While he briefly returned to the court, he ultimately announced his resignation by the end of 2013.

Career Earnings & Salary

YearTeamSalary 1995/96Washington Bullets$1,493,000 1996/97Portland Trail Blazers$2,060,000 1997/98Portland Trail Blazers$2,329,080 1998/99Portland Trail Blazers$9,000,000 1999/00Portland Trail Blazers$10,800,000 2000/01Portland Trail Blazers$12,600,000 2001/02Portland Trail Blazers$14,400,000 2002/03Portland Trail Blazers$16,200,000 2003/04Detroit Pistons$18,000,000 2005/06Detroit Pistons$10,860,000 2006/07Detroit Pistons$11,650,000 2007/08Detroit Pistons$12,540,000 2008/09Detroit Pistons$13,930,000 2009/10Boston Celtics$5,854,000 2010/11New York Knicks$6,322,320 2011/12New York Knicks$6,322,320 2012/13New York Knicks$854,389 Total Career Earnings:$155,215,109

Although Rasheed Wallace isn’t among the richest NBA players in the world, he has certainly earned a notable fortune.

When Rasheed Wallace joined the NBA in 1995, he earned $1.5 million in his first season.

In 1998, Wallace signed a 6-year contract with the Portland Trail Blazers, worth $80 million.

His average annual salary immediately jumped to $13.3 million per year.

While playing for Portland, Wallace’s salary grew roughly $2 million per year until he signed with the Detroit Pistons in 2003.

His contract with the Pistons was a 5-year deal, worth $58.7 million.

Although this deal meant a lower annual average salary than his time at Portland; Rasheed Wallace’s highest annual salary came during his first season in Detroit, where he earned $18 million.

Wallace’s final NBA contract was a 3-year deal with the Boston Celtics worth $18.9 million, averaging $6.3 million per year.

During his 17-season NBA career, Rasheed Wallace earned a total salary of $151 million.

His time with the Portland Trail Blazers accounts for $68.9 million of this amount and with the Detroit Pistons, $67 million.

Personal Life

Rasheed Wallace has three children with his wife, Fatima Sanders.

In his personal life, he is a follower of Islam and has also been one of the biggest advocates during the Flint water crisis.

During the summer of 2016, Rasheed personally handed out water to residents in Flint, Michigan, and wrote a letter to the Players Tribune to help raise awareness.

On social media, he can be found on his official Instagram account, where he posts about basketball and his personal interests.

Awards & Achievements

Rasheed Wallace has earned many awards and honors during his professional basketball career.

While all of his achievements have been significant, some of his accolades stand out more than others.

Here are some of Rasheed Wallace’s greatest career accomplishments:

In 1993, Wallace was named USA Today’s High School Player of the Year and Mr. Basketball USA.

Wallace was appointed to the First-team All-ACC.

He was named to the NBA All-Rookie Second Team in 1995.

In 2000, 2001, 2006, and 2008, Wallace was named to the NBA All-Star Team.

Wallace became an NBA Champion in 2004.

Like Dwyane Wade, Rasheed Wallace has won many impressive awards and honors during his professional basketball career.

While these are only a few of the many accolades and achievements that he has earned, they are by far the most important.

How Does Rasheed Wallace Spend His Money?

Rasheed Wallace has owned a number of expensive mansions in some of the most expensive cities in the US. However, some have been remarkably impressive.

In 1999, Wallace purchased a historic mansion for $3.1 million that was originally built in 1924.

This Tudor-style mansion is listed on the National Register of Historic Places, and it sits on two acres with a pool, sports court, guest house, Koi pond, and five-car garage.

Wallace put this home up for sale in 2018 for $3 million, though there has been no word of any buyers.

Although we don’t know where Wallace has since moved to, we can safely assume that it is similarly impressive.

Highlights

Rasheed Wallace’s career has been filled with memorable moments.

However, some of his milestones have stood out over the rest for their impact on his fame and fortune.

Here are some of the best highlights of Rasheed Wallace’s career:

Wallace started his collegiate basketball career at the University of North Carolina in 1993.

He was drafted by the Washington Bullets in 1995 and was appointed to the All-Rookie First Team.

In 1996, Wallace was traded to the Portland Trail Blazers and was named an NBA All-Star in 2000 and 2001.

Wallace joined the Detroit Pistons in 2004 and made his fourth All-Star appearance in 2008.

While Wallace retired in 2010, he came back in 2012 to play one more season with the New York Knicks.

Rasheed Wallace, having played for some of the richest NBA teams during his career, has earned much renown for his skills on the court.

Although these are only a few of his most significant milestones, they are the ones that have had the largest effect on his career.

Favorite Rasheed Wallace Quotes

Rasheed Wallace achieved a lot during his career in the NBA, and he has never lost his motivation to succeed.

While his skills alone were impressive, he also knew the value of teamwork and talked often about its importance.

Here are our favorite quotes from Rasheed Wallace:

“Everyone in their career is going to go through a slump, but the thing is how you react to it.” – Rasheed Wallace

“Everybody needs help, even Superman. That’s why he had the Justice League.” – Rasheed Wallace

“A wise man knows when to go ‘head and back off, so you gotta pick and choose your fights.” – Rasheed Wallace

“Some of the fans are mad at me; some of the fans cheer for me. I can’t worry about that.” – Rasheed Wallace

“If I feel as though myself or my teammates have been dealt a wrong hand, I’m going to let it be known.” – Rasheed Wallace

Summary

Rasheed Wallace left his mark in the NBA and earned a substantial net worth during his career.

While he retired in 2013, he has continued to coach a new generation of players at the University of Memphis.

Make sure you check back often so that you don’t miss any updates on Wallace’s wealth and coaching career.

As of July 2024, Rasheed Wallace’s net worth is estimated to be $75 Million.

What do you think about Rasheed Wallace’s net worth? Leave a comment below.

What is LeBron James’ net worth?

Net Worth:$1.2 Billion Age:39 Born:December 30, 1984 Gender:Male Height:2.05 m (6 ft 9 in) Country of Origin:United States of America Source of Wealth:Professional NBA Player Last Updated:Jul 24, 2024

LeBron James is an American professional NBA player for the Los Angeles Lakers, with an estimated net worth of $1.2 Billion.

In his career, LeBron has won several NBA championships and multiple MVP awards, earning himself the nickname “King James.” He’s also written books, starred in movies and TV shows, owned restaurants and clubs, and created a foundation that has given millions of dollars to help kids across America receive a better education.

His work ethic is legendary. LeBron once told NBA fans that he doesn’t want to be remembered as just a great basketball player; he wants them to recognize him as someone who impacted the world. James has been heralded as one of the best players in basketball history, next to no other than the great Michael Jordan. By all accounts, Lebron will be remembered as one of the greatest athletes and people ever.

Table of Contents

Toggle

Career Overview

In 2003, the Cleveland Cavaliers selected James as the overall pick of the NBA Draft. He was the youngest player ever to be picked first in an NBA draft at the time and is only one of two players ever to be drafted straight out of high school.

His first season was incredible. He set a new NBA record for the most points scored by a prep-to-pro player in his first game and was also named Rookie of the Year.

Within the next few seasons, LeBron rose to stardom, featured in his first All-Star Game, and won multiple Most Valuable Player awards.

In June 2010, LeBron announced that he would leave Cleveland and sign with the Miami Heat for a six-year deal worth $110 million. ESPN televised the decision on an hour-long special entitled ‘The Decision.’

In his first season in Miami, James helped the Heat reach the NBA Finals, where they lost to the Dallas Mavericks in six games. The following year, he won his first NBA championship as the Heat defeated the Oklahoma City Thunder in five games.

In 2013, James received his fourth NBA Most Valuable Player Award. He won a second consecutive championship in 2013 as the Heat defeated the San Antonio Spurs in seven games.

He played for the Miami Heat for four seasons, but in 2014, Lebron James decided to return to the Cleveland Cavaliers. With Lebron James as their leading scorer, the Cavaliers won the NBA championship in 2016 and 2017.

It wasn’t until 2018 that LeBron left the Cavaliers and joined the Los Angeles Lakers as a free agent, signing a four-year contract worth $154 million. James has won far too many awards to list, but you can see some of his best highlights below.

Earnings & Salary

YearTeamSalary 2005/06Cleveland Cavaliers$4,621,800 2006/07Cleveland Cavaliers$5,828,089 2007/08Cleveland Cavaliers$13,041,250 2008/09Cleveland Cavaliers$14,410,581 2009/10Cleveland Cavaliers$15,779,912 2010/11Miami Heat$14,500,000 2011/12Miami Heat$17,545,000 2012/13Miami Heat$19,067,500 2013/14Miami Heat$19,067,500 2014/15Cleveland Cavaliers$20,644,400 2015/16Cleveland Cavaliers$22,970,500 2016/17Cleveland Cavaliers$30,963,450 2018/19Los Angeles Lakers$35,654,150 2019/20Los Angeles Lakers$37,436,858 2020/21Los Angeles Lakers$39,219,565 2021/22Los Angeles Lakers$41,180,544 2022/23Los Angeles Lakers$44,474,988 2023/24Los Angeles Lakers$47,607,350 Total Career Earnings:$444,013,437

NBA Salary

When LeBron James first signed with the Cleveland Cavaliers in 2003, he secured a four-year, $18.8 million rookie contract. The deal would be worth $32.1 million if adjusted for inflation. James earned $4 million in his first NBA season, and his salary gradually increased to $5.8 million for the final year of the contract.

In 2007, LeBron signed a four-year extension with the Cavaliers worth $60.4 million. Between 2007 and 2010, he earned an average annual salary of $15 million.

In 2010, LeBron signed his first nine-figure contract, a $109.8 million 6-year sign-and-trade contract between the Cavaliers and the Miami Heat. However, only $64 million of the value was guaranteed, which is what LeBron earned from the contract.

James’ contract included an early termination option, which he exercised after the fourth year. This resulted in him earning $64 million over four years. This era of James’ career was coined “The Decision,” with many criticizing him for leaving the Cavaliers for Miami.

LeBron opted out of the contract two years early to sign back with Cleveland on a two-year, $42.2 million deal. He played one season, earning $20.6 million, before declining his play option. James resigned with the Cavs on a slightly higher-paying agreement, earning $23 million in 2015.

In 2016, LeBron signed his second nine-figure contract, valued at $100 million over three years. James earned $31 million with Cleveland in 2016 and $33.3 million in 2017. He secured just $64.2 million of the contract’s value before declining his third-year option.

In 2018, LeBron moved to the Los Angeles Lakers, signing his third nine-figure contract and the most valuable of his career. James inked a four-year, $153.3 million, fully guaranteed deal with the Lakers, increasing his average annual salary to $38.3 million.

The final year of the agreement was voided to allow James to negotiate a new two-year extension worth $85.6 million.

In 2023, he signed a two-year veteran extension worth $99 million, which was just shy of becoming his fourth nine-figure contract. Finally, in 2024, LeBron officially signed his fourth deal with a value of over $100 million. His current contract is a two-year, $101 million agreement that will earn him an estimated $48.7 million this year at 40 years old.

That figure will become the highest annual salary of his career; if he doesn’t decide to retire after that, he could earn an estimated $52.6 million salary in 2025.

LeBron is the only player in NBA history to have signed four 9-figure contracts.

Throughout his NBA career, LeBron James has earned $479.5 million in salary, with another $101 million guaranteed.

Endorsements

LeBron’s endorsement portfolio is awe-inspiring and includes Coca-Cola, Nike, Beats By Dre, Intel, Kia Motors, and Blaze Pizza. His most recent endorsement deal is with Verizon’s mobile television service.

The Lakers star reportedly signed a three-year deal with the company that will pay him approximately $30 million to promote the service on social media platforms such as Snapchat and Twitter.

LeBron also has business ventures, including Liverpool FC (a small stake), Blaze Pizza (his part ownership helped make it a billion-dollar brand), and Uninterrupted – a digital media company he founded.

LeBron also owns production companies SpringHill Entertainment and The Robot Company, through which he has produced films like Space Jam 2, which stars himself alongside Bugs Bunny; TV shows such as Survivor’s Remorse; documentaries like I Promise; commercial spots for Sprite soda; YouTube content, and more.

In addition to his off-court earnings from endorsements, business ventures, investments, and production companies, King James is also known for his philanthropy efforts. In 2017, he pledged to provide scholarships for kids who graduate from the I Promise School in Akron, Ohio, through his LeBron James Family Foundation.

Lebron James’ Net Worth

When we first covered LeBron’s net worth in 2019, it was estimated to be $440 million. Since then, he’s racked up an additional $172 million salary alone. His earnings from sponsors and endorsements now exceed his salary, taking home close to $350 million from sponsors since 2019. James is the only active NBA player to be listed by Forbes as a billionaire.

As of 2024, LeBron James’ net worth is now an astonishing $1.2 Billion.

More Current/Former Cleveland Cavaliers players:

Ricky Rubio Net Worth

Kevin Love Net Worth

Iman Shumpert Net Worth

Daniel Gibson Net Worth

Highlights

Here are some of the significant highlights from LeBron James’ career:

3 Time NBA Champion (2012, 2013, 2016)

3 Time NBA Final MVP (2012, 2013, 2016)

4 Time NBA Most Valuable Player (2009, 2010, 2012, 2013)

NBA Rookie of the Year (2004)

NBA Scoring Champion (2008)

Olympic Gold Medal Winner (2008, 2012)

NBA All-Rookie First Team (2004)

NBA All-Star Game MVP (2006, 2008)

Favorite Quotes from LeBron James

“There is a lot of pressure put on me, but I don’t put a lot of pressure on myself. I feel if I play my game, it will take care of itself.” – LeBron James

“My mom and I have always been there for each other. We had some tough times, but she was always there for me.” – LeBron James

“I don’t know how tall I am or how much I weigh. Because I don’t want anybody to know my identity. I’m like a superhero. Call me Basketball Man.” – LeBron James

“Being the only man in the household with my mom definitely helped me grow up fast.” – LeBron James

View our larger collection of the best LeBron James quotes!

3 Keys to Success from LeBron James

Now you know all about LeBron James’ net worth and how he achieved success, here are three success lessons we can all learn from LeBron James:

1. Learn from Others

Dwyane Wade and Pat Riley played a big part in teaching LeBron to become a true champion. This was midway through his career when he left for Miami Heat. His reason for leaving Cleveland was exactly this, to learn.

When LeBron moved back to Cleveland, he had a much more comprehensive range of knowledge, which he could bring back to the team.

2. Be A Great Leader

LeBron is all about teamwork and helping his team in any way he can to break the boundaries. He’s not in it for himself; he’s in it for the team. This is majorly why the teams he’s played in have done so well and improved his fame.

However, LeBron knows that being famous doesn’t mean anything if you can’t help others with that fame. He’s been working to make a difference since Day One of his NBA career and continues to do so today as a leader in the fight against racism.

3. Learn from Past Mistakes

If he had to do it all over again, James said he’d do plenty of things differently. That shows how much he’s learned from his mistakes and how it’s helped continuously elevate his game throughout his career.

Summary

LeBron James is, without a doubt, one of the best NBA players in history, and all the attention/awards he’s received show this. With LeBron James’ net worth at a whopping $1.2 Billion, he’s also one of the highest-paid athletes in the world.

However, his influence on the game of basketball has made him such a legend among an entire generation of players and fans. LeBron is much more than just “King James.” He’s a cultural icon and a national hero. He’s even a celebrity outside of basketball.

Still, none of this would have been possible if LeBron hadn’t taken on the responsibility to improve himself and evolve as a player and person throughout his illustrious career.

He’s a real inspiration for any aspiring athlete, proving that you can overcome any obstacle that life throws at you with hard work and dedication.

What do you think of LeBron James’ net worth? Leave a comment below.

What is Tracy McGrady’s net worth?

Net Worth:$70 Million Age:45 Born:May 24, 1979 Gender:Male Height:2.03 m (6 ft 8 in) Country of Origin:United States of America Source of Wealth:Professional NBA Player Last Updated:Jul 24, 2024

Table of Contents

Toggle

Introduction

Tracy McGrady is an American former professional NBA player with an estimated net worth of $70 Million.

In a career that spanned 15 seasons, McGrady earned $162.4 million in salary, plus additional income from shoe deals and sponsors. The shooting guard achieved a lifetime average of 19.6 points per game and a $10.8 million annual salary.

McGrady’s most valuable contract throughout his career was a $93 million, 5-year contract signed in 2000 with the Raptors. However, his single highest-earning year in the NBA wouldn’t come until 2009, when he earned $23.2 million with the New York Knicks.

Early Life

Tracy Lamar McGrady Jr. was born on May 24, 1979, in Bartow, Florida.

His mother raised him. As a youth, he played high school basketball at Auburndale High School for three years before transferring to Mount Zion Christian Academy in Durham.

During his final year at Auburndale, he posted averages of 23.1 points, 12.2 rebounds, four assists, and 4.9 blocks per game.

He made a name for himself after a strong performance at the Adidas ABCD Camp.

Career

In 2004, McGrady became the 4th player in 12 years to score over 60 points in a single game. In 2006, he became the 3rd youngest player in history to reach 14,000 points and 4,000 rebounds. He missed the remainder of the 2009 season due to having knee surgery.

In 2010, he joined the New York Knicks as part of 3 team trade involving New York, Houston, and the Sacramento Kings. McGrady has four children with his wife, CleRenda Harris.

During high school, McGrady was named Mr. Basketball USA and a McDonald’s All-American. The Toronto Raptors drafted him ninth overall in the 1997 NBA Draft.

He played for the Raptors from 1997 to 2000, the Orlando Magic from 2000 to 2004, the Houston Rockets from 2004 to 2010, the New York Knicks in 2010, the Detroit Pistons from 2010 to 2011, and the Atlanta Hawks from 2011 to 2012.

McGrady was named the NBA’s Most Improved Player in 2001 and was a two-time All-NBA First Team selection, three-time All-NBA Second Teamer, and two-time All-NBA Third Team selection.

Earnings & Salary

YearTeamSalary 1997/98Toronto Raptors$1,359,360 1998/99Toronto Raptors$1,563,000 1999/00Toronto Raptors$1,767,120 2000/01Orlando Magic$9,658,000 2001/02Orlando Magic$10,865,000 2002/03Orlando Magic$12,072,000 2003/04Orlando Magic$13,279,000 2004/05Houston Rockets$14,487,000 2005/06Houston Rockets$15,694,250 2006/07Houston Rockets$16,901,500 2007/08Houston Rockets$18,257,750 2008/09Houston Rockets$20,370,437 2009/10New York Knicks$22,843,124 2010/11Detroit Pistons$854,389 2011/12Atlanta Hawks$854,389 Total Career Earnings:$160,826,319

NBA Salary

In 1997, Tracy McGrady signed a three-year rookie contract worth $4.7 million with the Toronto Raptors. The deal was fully guaranteed, with McGrady earning $1.4 million for his first season in the NBA.

In 2000, McGrady signed the most valuable contract of his career: a seven-year, $93 million sing-and-trade agreement between the Raptors and the Orlando Magic. In today’s currency, the deal would be worth $169.7 million.

He played four seasons with Orlando, earning $45.9 million, before being traded to the Houston Rockets. McGrady played the remaining three years with the Rockets, earning an average of $15.33 million/year.

In 2007, he signed a 3-year veteran extension with Houston, valued at $62.7 million. These three years would produce the highest annual salaries in Tracy’s career. McGrady earned $39.4 million in the two seasons that followed at Houston, followed by $23.2 million in 2009 when he was traded to the New York Knicks.

By this point, McGrady was 30 years old and had already figured out just how injury-prone he was. Thus began the downturn of his professional basketball career.

From 2010 to 2012, McGrady played with three teams, earning a combined $2.5 million, before retiring in 2013.

During his NBA career, Tracy McGrady earned $162.4 million.

Estimated Net Worth

When we first researched McGrady’s net worth in 2021, he was worth an estimated $75 million. Given that he has been retired for over a decade, his wealth hasn’t grown significantly since then.

As of 2024, Tracy McGrady’s net worth is estimated to be $70 Million.

How Does Tracy McGrady Spend His Money?

Tracy McGrady spends his money on real estate and cars.

Tracy McGrady’s Home

McGrady owns a fantastic home in Orlando. It comes with 7 bedrooms, 8.5 bathrooms, an elevator, boat dock, and over 12,000+ square feet.

Tracy McGrady’s Cars

McGrady loves to drive a fancy car. One of his most notable purchases includes a customized blue Mercedez Benz.

Highlights

Here are some of the best highlights of Tracy McGrady’s career:

NBA Most Improved Player (2001)

2× All-NBA First Team (2002, 2003)

7× NBA All-Star (2001–2007)

CBA All-Star (2013)

Favorite Quotes from Tracy McGrady

“We felt like before the season started, leaving out all the injuries, we felt like we were going to be a pretty good team. We started out slow due to injuries. It kind of set us back a little bit. But winning that home game (against the Boston Celtics), then going on a six-game road trip, that was either going to make us or break us.” – Tracy McGrady

“I’m still in awe of what that kid did. It was just a hell of a performance for him to shoot the ball only 46 times to score 81 points. But not just to be able to shoot it 46 times, but to shoot it 46 times and hit well over 50 per cent. To take 46 and 20 free throws and end up with 81 points, I didn’t believe it.” – Tracy McGrady

“We’re definitely getting up with them coming back. The last four games, we’re playing very well. With our best players coming back, it’s only going to help improve our team even more and give us a lot more depth. … We’re back on track, and hopefully, we can stay like that.” – Tracy McGrady

“We don’t know who we are. We don’t know if we want to be a team that is to be reckoned with, or we just want to be a team that runs off a four-game win streak, and then we lay down and say, ‘So what?’ and just go back to our old selves. I don’t know, man.” -Tracy McGrady

“It’s every player’s personal goal, to make the All-Star team. It’s a personal accomplishment guys want to make to get a chance to participate against the elite players. Every player in this league wants to be there.” – Tracy McGrady

What do you think about Tracy McGrady’s net worth? Leave a comment below.

What is Reggie Jackson’s net worth?

Net Worth:$20 Million Age:34 Born:April 16, 1990 Gender:Male Height:1.88 m Country of Origin:United States of America Source of Wealth:Professional NBA Player Last Updated:Jul 24, 2024

Table of Contents

Toggle

Introduction

Reggie Jackson is an American professional NBA player for the Philadelphia 76ers with an estimated net worth of $20 Million.

After 13 years in the league, Jackson has earned over $115 million in salary, plus additional income through endorsements and sponsors. Jackson’s most valuable NBA contract came in 2021 when he signed a two-year, $21.6 million agreement with the Los Angeles Clippers.

Thus far into his career, the point guard has achieved a lifetime average of 10.2 points per game, 3.8 assists per game, and $8.8 million per year in salary. In July 2024, Jackson agreed to a contract buyout with the Charlotte Hornets, allowing him to rejoin the Philadelphia 76ers.

Reggie Jackson Facts

Jackson was born in Pordenone, Italy, but grew up in Colorado, where he attended Palmer High School.

He attended Boston College from 2008 to 2011, playing three seasons with the Eagles.

In the 2011 NBA Draft, the Oklahoma City Thunder drafted Jackson in the late first round (24th overall).

He made his NBA debut against the Dallas Mavericks on December 18, 2011, and scored three points and two assists..

Early Life

Reginald Shon Jackson was born on April 16, 1990, in Pordenone, Italy, and attended high school in Colorado Springs, Colorado.

Jackson’s family lived in several cities around the United States while he was growing up, and his father was in the United States military.

While attending Palmer High School in Colorado Springs, Jackson was named the state’s top basketball player and received multiple scholarship offers.

Jackson decided to attend Boston College and spent three seasons there, where he earned First-Team All-ACC honors. He forgoed his senior season to declare for the NBA Draft.

Career Overview

The Oklahoma City Thunder drafted Jackson with the 24th overall selection in 2011, which featured Kyrie Irving as the top pick. Jackson wouldn’t see significant playing time in his first two seasons.

Jackson was part of a three-team trade in early 2015 that sent him to the Detroit Pistons, where he instantly received more playing time alongside Andre Drummond in the lineup.

He played for Detroit in at least part of six seasons, averaging 16.2 points, 5.6 assists, and 2.9 rebounds per game during his time as a Piston.

Jackson was waived by the Pistons during the 2019-220 season and subsequently signed with the Los Angeles Clippers.

In 2023, Jackson and a future second-round pick were traded to the Charlotte Hornets in exchange for Mason Plumlee. Jackson and the Hornets negotiated a buyout agreement, allowing him to sign with the Denver Nuggets on February 14, 2022.

Eighteen months later, Jackson would be re-signed to the Hornets via a large-scale sign-and-trade deal involving six teams.

Earnings & Salary

YearTeamSalary 2011/12Oklahoma City Thunder$1,156,320 2012/13Oklahoma City Thunder$1,260,360 2013/14Oklahoma City Thunder$1,260,360 2014/15Detroit Pistons$2,204,369 2015/16Detroit Pistons$13,913,044 2016/17Detroit Pistons$14,956,522 2017/18Detroit Pistons$17,043,478 2018/19Detroit Pistons$17,043,478 2019/20LA Clippers$512,721 2020/21LA Clippers$1,620,564 2021/22LA Clippers$10,384,500 2022/23Denver Nuggets$580,373 2023/24Denver Nuggets$5,000,000 Total Career Earnings:$86,936,089

NBA Salary

In 2011, Reggie Jackson signed a four-year rookie contract worth $5.8 million with the Oklahoma City Thunder. The deal was fully guaranteed, with Jackson earning $930,000 in his first NBA season.

Jackson played three seasons with the Thunder, earning $3.4 million, before finishing his contract with the Detroit Pistons, where he took home another $2.2 million.

In 2015, Reggie signed a five-year, fully guaranteed $80 million contract with the Detroit Pistons. His salary increased dramatically to $13.9 million, and by the fourth year of the contract, he was earning $17 million/year.

For the 2019/20 season, Jackson would only play for half of the season before being waived by the Pistons, having already negotiated a buyout agreement. He was estimated to have been paid $17.3 million by the Pistons for the season.

Jackson spent the second half of the 2019/20 season playing for the Los Angeles Clippers on a one-year, rest-of-season contract worth $734,000.

He later resigned with the Clippers on a two-year deal worth $21.6 million, fully guaranteed. Reggie earned $10.4 million with the Clippers for the 2021/22 season before he was traded to the Charlotte Hornets in February 2023.

He was subsequently offered a contract buyout agreement and signed five days later with the Denver Nuggets. Jackson earned $11.8 million for the 22/23 season, which comprised $3.5 million from his Hornets buyout, $7.4 million retained from the Clippers, and $900,000 in active income from the Nuggets.

His current deal is a two-year contract worth $10.25 million with the Denver Nuggets; however, for the final season of the deal, he will play for the Charlotte Hornets.

Thus far in his NBA career, Reggie Jackson has earned $115.1 million.

How Does Reggie Jackson Spend His Money?

Despite his high net worth, Reggie Jackson has not bought the most expensive houses or cars in the world.

Jackson has mostly been renting homes since his early career, when he played for several franchises. When he broke into the NBA, Jackson rented an apartment and even a car instead of purchasing one for himself.

Now that he’s in the latter half of his NBA career and has made tens of millions, Jackson will likely start looking for houses as he settles down.

Reggie Jackson’s Net Worth Annually

Like many who played on a rookie contract, Reggie Jackson was building a foundation for his net worth until his first big contract came in.

2015 was that time for Jackson, as he inked a new deal that would pay him $80 million over five years, all of which was guaranteed.

The figures of Paul George’s net worth are estimated based on his NBA salaries and endorsements and are not guaranteed to be 100% accurate.

Here’s a breakdown of Reggie Jackson’s annual net worth:

Reggie Jackson’s Net Worth In 2013 – $2 Million

Reggie Jackson’s Net Worth In 2014 – $3.7 Million

Reggie Jackson’s Net Worth In 2015 – $13 Million

Reggie Jackson’s Net Worth In 2016 – $21 Million

Reggie Jackson’s Net Worth In 2017 – $30 Million

Reggie Jackson’s Net Worth In 2018 – $41 Million

Reggie Jackson’s Net Worth In 2019 – $40 Million

Reggie Jackson’s Net Worth In 2020 – $40 Million

Reggie Jackson’s Net Worth In 2021 – $45 Million

Reggie Jackson’s Net Worth In 2022 – $50 Million

Though his production indicates that Jackson still has several years left of NBA ability, he could retire comfortably today if he wanted to.

Jackson will likely receive shorter-term contracts as he gets closer to the end of his career, which is common for players in their 30s.

Personal Life

Reggie Jackson is the son of Saul and Sharon Jackson, with his father serving the military which resulted in the family moving to several locations including Italy and England. Since 2017, Jackson has been in a relationship with model and athlete Jayne Caldwell, though their marital status remains a mystery. If they are indeed married, it would be the first for Jackson, and he does not have any children currently.

Jackson is active on social media with an official Twitter account and an official Instagram account that are both updated regularly.

Awards & Achievements

Here are some of the best awards and achievements from Reggie Jackson’s career:

Named Gatorade Colorado Boys’ Basketball Player of the Year in 2008.

Rated as a top 30 shooting guard in his high school class nationally.

Reached the NCAA Tournament as a member of the Boston College Eagles.

Named as a First-Team All-ACC Selection in his final year of college.

Reached the Western Conference Finals twice in his NBA career.
